title: How to Create a Google Account Using a New or Existing Email

steps.title: Go to https://accounts.google.com/signin.
steps.content: Go to https://accounts.google.com/signin . You can do this on any browser, even the browser on your smartphone or tablet! If you're already signed into a Google account and you want to make a new one, click your profile picture in the top-right corner and click Add another account .

steps.title: Click Create account.
steps.content: Click Create account . It's next to the Next button. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Choose an account type.
steps.content: Choose an account type. You can create an account for your work or business, a child, or for your personal use. The required fields change a little depending on what you're creating an account for, but they mostly follow the same steps. For my personal use: Use if you want to make an account for you to use personally. For my child: This type of account can have restrictions on it based on age or ratings. This is a great option if you want to manage your own child's Google account. For work or my business: Use this if you want to use Google as a business. You'll have the ability to connect your real-life business so people can find it online.

steps.title: Add your first and last name.
steps.content: Add your first and last name. Your first name is required, but your last name is optional.

steps.title: Fill out your birthday and gender.
steps.content: Fill out your birthday and gender. Google uses your birthday to ensure you're old enough for certain age-restricted content or services. [2] X Research source Your gender is used to personalize your Google experience with proper pronouns. [3] X Research source Google allows you to choose between Male , Female , Rather not say , or Custom for your gender. If you opt not to specify a gender, Google will use gender-neutral terms (i.e., they/them pronouns).

steps.title: Come up with a username.
steps.content: Come up with a username. By default, your username will become your new Gmail address (it will be [yourusername]@gmail.com). To learn how to use an existing email to make a Google account, see the steps below . Instead of giving you a text box to fill out, sometimes Google will provide you with a few username suggestions right off the bat. To choose your own, click Create your own Gmail address . If your username is taken or not available, you will be given several related options, or you can try a different one.

steps.title: Create a password.
steps.content: Create a password. If you want to see the password as you type it, click the Show password checkbox. Make sure to create a strong password that you can remember .

steps.title: Add a recovery email.
steps.content: Add a recovery email. If you forget your Google account password, you can use your recovery email to easily reset it. If you don't want to add a recovery email, click Skip .

steps.title: Agree to the terms of service and privacy policy.
steps.content: Agree to the terms of service and privacy policy. Take the time to read all of the terms of service and privacy policy so that you are aware of what Google can and can’t do with your personal information. Click More options to change your account settings for web and app activity saving, ad personalization, and YouTube history saving. After clicking I agree , the account creation process is complete. If you want to make multiple accounts, make sure you're logged out and repeat the process.

steps.title: Click Use your existing email.
steps.content: Click Use your existing email . This option is next to the Next button.

steps.title: Enter your email address.
steps.content: Enter your email address. You cannot use a Gmail email address for this step; it must be a non-Gmail address.

steps.title: Enter the code sent to your email.
steps.content: Enter the code sent to your email. Google will send a verification code to the email you entered. Get the verification code and enter it on this screen.

steps.title: Can I make a Google account without a phone number?
steps.content: Can I make a Google account without a phone number? Yes, you can make a Google account without a phone number. In the past, Google asked for your phone number for verification purposes. However, a phone number is no longer required to set up a Google account.

steps.title: Can a 12 year old have a Google account?
steps.content: Can a 12 year old have a Google account? Yes, a 12 year old can have a Google account as long as their parent creates the account and manages it through Family Link. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Is a Google account free?
steps.content: Is a Google account free? Yes, Google accounts are free. The exception is if you pay for more storage with a [ Google One subscription ].

steps.title: Is a Google account the same as a Gmail account?
steps.content: Is a Google account the same as a Gmail account? Kind of. Technically speaking, if you have a Gmail account, you also have a Google account. However, Gmail is just one of the many services you can access with your Google account. If you create an account with any Google service, you can use that same account to sign into and use any Google service (such as Google Drive, YouTube, etc.). [8] X Research source

steps.title: How do I create another Google account?
steps.content: How do I create another Google account? To create another Google account, you can sign out of your current Google account and go to https://accounts.google.com/signin to create a new one. You can also click on your profile picture when using any Google service (in the upper right corner) and click Add another account to create a new account. You can then easily switch between Google accounts when using Google services.
